intro: Raulinoa, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep pink. Raulinoa typically grows in rocky soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a velvety texture.
